files.description: This file defines data structures for parsing and representing Typst package manifests, including package information, template details, and tool configurations. It also provides utilities for parsing and validating package specifications.
This file implements a system for loading, caching, and managing Typst source files and their raw byte content, supporting incremental compilation through a pluggable `FileLoader` interface.

This file manages the loading, retrieval, and storage of Typst packages from various sources, including local file system directories (data and cache) and the Typst Universe registry, handling versioning and network downloads.

This file implements the functionality for Typst to load and interact with WebAssembly modules as plugins. It defines the `plugin` function, `PluginFunc` structure, and the protocol for WebAssembly plugins to be used within Typst documents.

This file defines the `RootedPath` type and related functionality for handling file system paths within Typst. It manages path resolution (relative/absolute), enforces project and package root boundaries, and defines how paths are represented and validated.

This file defines procedural macros for the Typst typesetting system. It provides macros like `func`, `ty`, `elem`, and `scope` to enable Rust functions, types, and structs to be exposed and used within the Typst language, managing their properties, arguments, and associated scopes.

This directory represents a test package named 'future' at version '0.1.0' within the Typst test suite. Its purpose is to validate aspects of the Typst package system, potentially including package discovery, resolution, or the handling of empty packages.

This directory represents version 0.1.0 of the 'adder' package, situated within the Typst testing suite. Its purpose is likely to serve as a test fixture or placeholder, possibly to evaluate how the Typst package system handles minimal or empty packages during benchmark testing.

This directory is designated to contain the source code for version 0.1.0 of the 'reader' package, as used within the `typst` testing suite. Its current empty state suggests that the actual package source might be external to this test setup, or this specific test doesn't require direct source files here.

IDE & Language Services.description: Enhances the authoring experience in code editors by providing language services like autocompletion, syntax highlighting, error diagnostics, and contextual help.

files.description: This file provides the core logic for autocompletion within the Typst IDE. It analyzes the cursor position and surrounding syntax to suggest relevant completions, including markup snippets, math symbols, and code elements.

This file provides utilities for finding, collecting, and processing documentation within the Typst IDE, supporting both native Typst documentation and custom doc comments. It includes functions to extract documentation for values and parameters, and to summarize documentation into plain text.
This file provides functions to generate contextual tooltips for different elements (e.g., expressions, imports, labels, parameters, fonts) in a Typst source file, primarily for IDE integration.

This file implements functionality to determine a jump destination (e.g., source code, URL, or document position) based on a click within a rendered document, supporting both PagedDocument and HtmlDocument types. It enables 'click-to-jump' features for the IDE.

This file implements the core logic for finding the definition of an item (like a variable, function, import, or reference) in Typst source code, supporting both user-defined and standard library elements. It is a key component of the Typst IDE's 'go to definition' functionality.

This file defines the core functionalities and interfaces for providing IDE support for the Typst language, including features like analysis, autocompletion, definition lookup, and jump-to-definition.
This file describes an unmaintained, development-only VS Code extension for Typst language support, highlighting its limitations and recommending an alternative extension.
This file provides static analysis functionalities for Typst code within an IDE context, including evaluating expressions, resolving imports, and extracting document labels and bibliography keys.

This file provides utility functions for a Typst IDE to analyze source code, including finding named items (variables, functions, modules, imports) and categorizing expressions within the Abstract Syntax Tree (AST).

This file provides various utility functions for the Typst IDE, including creating temporary engine instances, summarizing font families, determining global scopes based on AST nodes, and recursively searching through Typst values.

This file provides functionality for pretty-printing diagnostic messages (errors, warnings, hints, and traces) from the Typst library using `codespan-reporting`, adapting the Typst world interface to `codespan`'s file system requirements.

This file defines structures and macros for handling and reporting diagnostics, including errors and warnings, within the Typst system. It provides mechanisms for creating, customizing with hints, and propagating these diagnostic messages.

This file defines a `TestWorld` struct and related utilities, providing a mock implementation of the Typst `World` and `IdeWorld` traits specifically for testing purposes within the `typst-ide` crate. It allows tests to easily set up custom files, assets, and configurations.
This README provides an overview and installation instructions for a VS Code extension designed to help manage the Typst test suite, offering features like viewing, running, and saving test outputs.

This file implements a VS Code extension that provides testing utilities for Typst projects. It includes code lenses for running and viewing tests, and a WebView panel to display test results and interact with testing commands.
